thread.title: Eriksen brilliance helps Tottenham Hotspur to settle with draw against Swansea
thread.title_full: Eriksen brilliance helps Tottenham Hotspur to settle with draw against Swansea | The Financial Express

author: financialexpress.com
title: Eriksen brilliance helps Tottenham Hotspur to settle with draw against Swansea
text:
Other Articles India thrash New Zealand 3-1 to level Hockey Test series Baseball: Young Astros soar high with first playoff success Jordan Spieth, Johnson paired for Presidents Cup foursomes Danish midfielder Christian Eriksen stunned Swansea City with two brilliant free-kicks to help Tottenham Hotspur settle with a 2-2 draw in their Premier League clash at the Liberty Stadium.
Forward player Andre Ayew put Swansea in the lead first in the 16th minute before Eriksen scored an equalizer for his side, the Mirror reported.
Tottenham, who dominated for long periods, could not take their chances in open play and secure what would have been a fourth straight league win for the first time since January 2014.
Tottenham forward Harry Kaneâ€™s own goal in the 31st minute put Swansea in lead again.
Eriksen scored the second goal for the English club in the 65th minute to make it 2-2.
Tottenham will next lock horns with Liverpool, who also had to settle with draw against Everton in their Premier League clash.
 05, 2015 11:55 am
